actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4666.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4666 â€” "To require the Inspector General of the Small Business Administration to submit a quarterly report on fraud relating to certain COVID-19 loans."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 28.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Robert Garcia (CA) notified the House of his intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The Chair designated Mr. Van Orden to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 28.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The House received a message from the Senate. That the Senate insisted upon its amendment to H.R. 2670, agreed to a conference, and appointed conferees.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mariannette Miller-Meeks to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
